title: brain pressure from it?
post:
Hi guys 

I've been on Wellbutrin on and off for the last year or so. Been on 150xl then 300xl then back to 150xl, 100sr 2x per day and back to the same 300xl that i'm holding since a month now.

Its my first time tolerating 300xl and the good effects are being felt. Still a anxious wreck tho.

I don't know if its part of the anxiety but I really somehow feel like there a pressure on the back of my head. I don't think its a tight muscle thing, it really feel like if my brain is "overheating" or "making new connection"

I can't say it makes me feel bad, just weird? I looked around and it seems like i'm the only one in the world feeling it. Not really alot of side effect now a month after jumping on 300xl again, but this... and physical anxiety sometimes.

The pressure is felt from "inside  the skull, it probably does make sense at all, but thats the best way the describe it. Kinda like brain zap from ssri, but in a enjoyable more constant feeling.

Anyone else?
disclosure: I've been on Wellbutrin on and off
label: Health

title: Can what I say in therapy be used against me?
post: I want to start therapy again and talk about some childhood trauma but I'm worried that if I reveal that that the VA could claim my depression isn't from the military and reduce my rating. Is this possible or am I being paranoid? Also, do the doctors at the VA get to see all of my disabilities and issues? Like can they read my therapy notes if they want to?
comment: I work in medical records at my VA, and I'm not a doctor. I have read a TON of vets therapy notes and have access to everything the doctors, nurse, CNAs etc can see. So yes, if the doctor wants they can read and see anything and everything from your VA visits, as well as outside medical records. I don't know your childhood trauma, what your rating is, or even what you went through in the military. However, I would be cautious as to what you say regarding childhood trauma because yes, they can use it to reduce you. Also, it may help you if its your first claim for mental health. Any mental trauma prior to the military, CAN be exacerbated by the military itself.
disclosure: I work in medical records at my VA
label: Occupation

title: Can what I say in therapy be used against me?
post: I want to start therapy again and talk about some childhood trauma but I'm worried that if I reveal that that the VA could claim my depression isn't from the military and reduce my rating. Is this possible or am I being paranoid? Also, do the doctors at the VA get to see all of my disabilities and issues? Like can they read my therapy notes if they want to?
comment: I have a long history of childhood trauma. I’ve said this to my vet center therapist, in prolonged exposure therapy and also to my EMDR therapist. I was completely open with my entire trauma history as well as my trauma in the military. I found out that I had complex PTSD before I even joined the army, and my trauma in the military made everything worse. It hasn’t been used against me, and I have been 100% P&T for PTSD since 2017. I’ve been 100% for PTSD since 2010.
disclosure: I have a long history of childhood trauma

title: Can anyone relate ?
post:
So I’ve been diagnosed with adhd at the age of 10 or so. I took pills until I was 12 and then stopped Bc my mom said I grew out of it. 

Well I’m 20 now and I don’t think my ADHD ever kicked this hard 🤡

Does anyone else get those hyper focus phases ? 

For instance, I will play sims 4 for 3 months straight, nothing else. Then I would get into animal crossing again and boom playing for 3 months straight. Then I’m thinking I could easily build a miniature house, well that lastet 3 days, I would be working on that for 12 h straight. I be staring so many things like dancing, horse riding etc but then just stop Bc the hyper focus is over. 

Or at 3 am I be making a list of what I’ll be cleaning, cooking or doing tomorrow. We’ll never happens 

Or I’ll be mid sentence and then just suddenly talk about something else that just shoot into my brain. 

Or I have 5 topics in my head that I want to express at the same time. 


So can someone relate 😅 if yes, what do you do about these things ?
label: Health

title: looking for hotel recommendations in downtown Atlanta needing suggestions
post: Me and my wife have a weekend trip planned in January for the stranger things experience and are needed recommendations for hotels in downtown. Any suggestions appreciated.
comment:
I’ve stayed at the Ritz, Westin, Hyatt, Hilton, and Marriot within the last 24/mo. Other than the Ritz, the Westin is the only lower cost hotel I’d consider staying at again. 

I wouldn’t stay at any of the others again. Terrible, terrible experiences with other hotel guests. The Ritz Carlton is a safe bet that guests that behave poorly won’t be staying there. 

The biggest issue I had at the other downtown hotels were people drunkenly roaming the halls at night screaming obscenities, and hotel security not having the staff to do absolutely anything about it.
disclosure: I’ve stayed at the Ritz, Westin, Hyatt, Hilton, and Marriot
label: Other

title: Spikes out of nowhere??
post:
I’ve been off my medicine for several months now and have been properly managing my diabetes through diet and exercise. My A1c test this month was a 6.4 (down from a 6.5 last month) and overall my sugar readings haven’t been too bad.

Two days ago I started feeling really crappy and checked my sugar to find it 250. It didn’t go down throughout the night or the next morning. Called my Dr. and she had me come in to do labs to make sure everything was fine which it was. 

It finally starting dropping around 4pm but it only got into the 160s before it spiked to the 200s again after eating dinner (this dinner maybe had 9 carbs max). 

I woke up with it at 215 again today and still feel gross. 

Any ideas what might be causing the spikes? I haven’t been eating a bunch of sugar/carbs and I didn’t take a break in my exercise so I’m a little lost!
label: Health

I woke up with it at 215 again today and still feel gross. 

Any ideas what might be causing the spikes? I haven’t been eating a bunch of sugar/carbs and I didn’t take a break in my exercise so I’m a little lost!
comment: Period/ovulation/sick/infection are all the things that makes my blood sugar weird.  I usually get higher blood sugar at my period but this time it went ultra low and my average yesterday was 4.6 was weird.  I find with hormone stuff it goes higher or lower and with sickness/infection it just goes high and doesnt come down for a few extra hours.  So like my 4 hour pp will be  the high end of normal even if I eat minimal carbs.  I had an infection early december and I didnt even feel bad for a few days then it was sinus/uti at the same time and I felt minimal discomfort but it showed in blood work.  Makes you wonder what your blood sugar was like with these things when non diabetic.  Sick people who don't have diabetes also have blood sugar go up idk how much though
label: Gender

title: Local spots in NYC?
post:
I live in London and I never get it when people come here and only stay around Central London, that's such a small part of the city and to really see the communities that make London so great you have to get further out. I'm sure the same is true for New York? 

I've been quite a few times but not for many years and I'm coming back next month, I've seen the usual spots in Manhattan and I'm wondering what other spots you guys would recommend checking out? I love street food/ cheap restaurants, diverse vibrant communities, nice parks, bars, cinemas etc.
label: Location

title: [Looking for] 26F looking for a room or roommates starting 3/1 or 4/1
post:
Hi! I might be looking too early, but I wanted to post anyway—I’m 26F looking for a room in Brooklyn starting 3/1 or 4/1, preferably Bushwick or Williamsburg. I’m pretty open to exploring other options, though. My max budget is $1500.

title: Exercising with joint problems
post: I’m looking for advice/support from others in a similar situation or who know about it.  I have fibromyalgia on top of hyper-mobility syndrome, it’s really painful and when I’m not in a flare up just normal exercise like walking, cycling etc… hurts (in a flare up just daily activities are a struggle), plus for normal people their muscles might ache for a couple of days after, it can take a week or more for my pain to ease to an acceptable level.  I hate it, I’m on various pain killers to target the different causes of the pain, my rheumatologist has said jogging/running is a definite no due to my main issues being in my knees and hips.  I’m very overweight, I know exercise is the key as well as diet, I’ve lost a stone through diet changes but I need to exercise more.  I’ve tried yoga which is good but it doesn’t get the heart pumping!  I’m a nurse, I work 13 hour shifts and I’m a mum to 2 young girls, I’m not lazy as people sometimes presume when they hear fibromyalgia.  So if anyone has any exercise tips for a total newbie and with these conditions (plus severe asthma if that makes a difference) I’d love your help.  If you’ve read this far but can’t help, thank you for listening.
label: Health

comment: Hey there, I experience hyper mobility and fibromyalgia too. The biggest game changers for me are learning properly about pacing and self compassion when it comes to movement and pain. Also, I imagine you are exhausted-your job is so full on. Doing yoga or other strengthening things is actually really excellent because it will help you have a strong foundation without completely wearing you out. Also, I’ve found Nordic walki g really helpful as it’s so supportive.
label: Health

title: If I wanna apply for a credit card on a bank, is it better to open a savings account on a branch or is it the same as online?
post: Which of the two has a higher chance of getting approved if ever mag aapply ako ng credit card sa bank. Or the same lang ba?
comment:
In my experience, I got my first CC when I opened a joint account sa BDO. They issued 2 cards for me that time. Pero kung without opening a bank account, I would have been rejected outright kasi I was only making 8 thousand a month back then. Yeah, sucks to be an LGU contractual employee.

And due to my cards from BDO, I was able to easily apply a card from Citibank.
disclosure: I got my first CC when I opened a joint account sa BDO.
label: Finance

title: Avett NYE Show Package
post:
Hey everyone, I’m new on here so please ignore if it’s not allowed. My wife and I purchased tickets for the NYE show in Charlotte. Have really been looking forward to it but are both sick with the flu. Wanted to see if anyone here was interested in it.

The package includes show perks and one night in OMNI Charlotte hotel (check in 12/31, check out 1/1/23). This package is for two people. We paid $820 but wanting to sell for $650. Hopefully this can be something that’s a fun last minute show for someone and we can recoup some money spent. 

Concert inclusions:

Two General Admission Pit ticket with early entry 

Invitation to an exclusive pre-show party in “The Perfect Space” Lounge with complimentary food and cash bar

Access to “The Perfect Space” Lounge throughout the entire evening

Complimentary coat check
Two limited edition event poster

Two exclusive The Avett Brothers merchandise item

Here’s the link with all the info: https://www.cidentertainment.com/events/the-avett-brothers-nye/
label: Wife_GF

title: What is this called? And why?
post: Why is it when I experience something traumatic I feel 0 emotions? Like my father dying, or witnessing a gruesome argument/fight?
comment: PTSD causes me to shut down in stressful events. I'm not a doctor by any means, but I think that you're shutting down because your brain is trying to keep yourself alive in what it sees as a threatening situation. It shuts down your fight or flight and essentially stops "recording" so that you can focus on your survival. I view my trauma like I'm watching a movie because my brain fully disconnected me from the experiences. Triggers cause my brain to return to that moment, attached with the emotions I should have felt then. Having flashbacks of traumatic events months after the event is usually how people discover that they have PTSD, because suddenly that apathetic disconnect becomes overwhelmingly personal. I wish you the best and it can be helpful to learn PTSD coping skills for any kind of trauma whether it causes PTSD or not. Good luck and stay safe.
disclosure: PTSD causes me to shut down
